20:

item.title: Changeset [1828]: PATH_INFO page links now include the index. Bug 404.
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: PATH_INFO page links now include the index. Bug 404.

item.title: Ticket #404 (get_page_link produces invalid URIs for IIS) created
item.dc:creator: dennis
item.description:
For SES permalinks, needs to put "index.php" in the URI similar to get_category_link or using one or the other of:

using_index_permalinks() page_permastruct()

item.title: Ticket #403 (Category Base needs "index.php" for IIS) created
item.dc:creator: dennis
item.description:
On IIS, where "index.php" is required for the Permilink Structure, it is also required for Category Base when the user wants to set it to something like "/taxonomy/categorias" as in the example on the page. The code functions properly - it may just require clarification of the instructions.

Also where it says 'If you leave this blank the default will be used.' it could say what the default is.

item.title: Ticket #402 (no email when comments posted) created
item.dc:creator: davidcrickett
item.description: In the last many versions of WordPress 1.3 nightly builds, I have gotten no email notification whatsover. And I have checked...

item.title: Ticket #401 (Awaiting Moderation doesn't show date/time of post) created
item.dc:creator: dennis
item.description:
Awaiting Moderation (Moderation Queue) doesn't show date/time of post.

Manage Comments does show date/time for comments awaiting moderation.

item.description: Fix REQUEST_URI construction for IIS. Bug 389. Patch from Dennis Williamson.

item.title: Ticket #400 (Making column headings clearer on Admin Link Categories page) created
item.dc:creator: dennis
item.description:
In the columns on the Link Categories page the text "Desc." is used for "Description" and "Desc?" is used for "Descending".

Also, it's not clear that "Show" includes only "Images", "Description", "Rating" and "Updated"

"Formatting" should also clearly show what it applies to.

item.title: Ticket #399 (Cookie problem with wikka) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I have a wikka wiki on my ./ and a wordpress blog on ./blog. The wikka wiki stores his cookie:

Name PHPSESSID Value 1fd012172ec187ba3f51a64f45636d91 Host www.aronchi.org Path / Expires At End Of Session

Name password Value 284842e87a7b5e73ee7ab9a5d600e2f7 Host www.aronchi.org Path / Expires 20/01/2005 14:27:43

Name name Value AlessandroRonchi Host www.aronchi.org Path / Expires 20/01/2005 14:27:43

When wikka stores those cookies wordpress says to me: "Sorry, no posts matched your criteria." If I delete those cookies wordpress returns to work.

Wordpress cookies are stored into wordpressuser and wordpresspass, where does this problem came from?

Thanks in advance.

item.title: Ticket #398 (Cookie problem with wikka) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I have a wikka wiki on my ./ and a wordpress blog on ./blog. The wikka wiki stores his cookie:

Name PHPSESSID Value 1fd012172ec187ba3f51a64f45636d91 Host www.aronchi.org Path / Expires At End Of Session

Name password Value 284842e87a7b5e73ee7ab9a5d600e2f7 Host www.aronchi.org Path / Expires 20/01/2005 14:27:43

Name name Value AlessandroRonchi Host www.aronchi.org Path / Expires 20/01/2005 14:27:43

When wikka stores those cookies wordpress says to me: "Sorry, no posts matched your criteria." If I delete those cookies wordpress returns to work.

Wordpress cookies are stored into wordpressuser and wordpresspass, where does this problem came from?

Thanks in advance.

item.title: Ticket #397 (clear attribute of the feedback class in wp-layout.css) created
item.dc:creator: SK8orDIE
item.description: W3 CSS Validator ​http://jigsaw.w3.org/css-validator/ Reports that the clear attribute of the feedback class in wp-layout.css should have a value of "both" instead of "all"

item.title: Ticket #396 (Comment spamming in inexistant posts) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Precondition 1: Comment system is completely disabled by the admin and does not accept submissions. Precondition 2: Some posts IDs do not exist (i.e. deleted by the admin) Problem: Spamming bots can submit comments to inexistant posts even when Precondition 1 is true. These submissions wait in the moderation queue. Outcome: Admin has to delete tons of unpublished spam comments. Version: 1.2.1 Mingus Installation: ​http://nsk.wikinerds.org

item.title: Ticket #395 (Require old password when changing password) created
item.dc:creator: trevorturk
item.description: I think it would be good to require the old password when changing password of a user.
